info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 2:35PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McDowell, northeastern Henderson and southeastern Buncombe Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 235 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Downtown Asheville, or near East Asheville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Asheville, East Asheville, Arden, West Asheville, North Asheville, Black Mountain, Fletcher, Swannanoa, Fairview In Buncombe County and Biltmore Forest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
